intro: Mollinedia heteranthera, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly referred to as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green inflorescences that resemble grass-like spikes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a prominent midrib. Mollinedia heteranthera typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and along stream banks.
